AL.051.Disposal_measures: Correct connection，reconnect power, If always appear, then change a drive

AL.052.Alarm_reason: Master control MCU power-on initialization exception, Serial port baud rate setting is too high
AL.052.Fault_alarm_checking_: 1、Check the connection 2、Check the baud rate parameter P00-21 of serial port communication
AL.052.Disposal_measures: Reduce the baud rate of Serial Communication, If always appear, then change a drive

AL.053.Alarm_reason: Master control MCU power-on initialization failed
AL.053.Disposal_measures: If always appear, then change a drive

AL.054.Disposal_measures: If always appear, then change a drive

AL.060.Alarm_reason: Product parameter setting does not match the actual hardware
AL.060.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check product parameter setting and hardware type for motor rated current greater than drive output current
AL.060.Disposal_measures: correct product settings , if it always appears, Contact the manufacturer

AL.061.Alarm_reason: Servo unit and servo motor type mismatch
AL.061.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check whether the servo supports the motor.Check 6
AL.061.Disposal_measures:
Set product parameters correctly
If it always appears, contact the manufacturer.

AL.063.Alarm_reason: The current of servo power module is too large.
AL.063.Fault_alarm_checking_:
Is there a short circuit in U, V and W wiring?
Is there a short circuit between B1 and B3?
AL.063.Disposal_measures: wiring Correctly If it always appears, replace the driver.

AL.064.Alarm_Content_: Servo power on ，Self-Test find out the output short circuit fault

AL.065.Alarm_Content_: built-in Fan stop of servo unit

AL.066.Alarm_Content_: control power in low voltage of servo unit
AL.066.Alarm_reason: Control power supply L, N power supply voltage is too low.
AL.066.Fault_alarm_checking_:
Check wiring is correct.
Measure L, N voltage whether is below 140VAC
AL.066.Disposal_measures: wiring Correctly If it always appears, replace the driver.

AL.071.Alarm_reason: Abnormal sampling data for current sensor
AL.071.Disposal_measures: wiring Correctly If it always appears, replace the driver.

AL.100.Disposal_measures:
Set parameters correctly
If it always appears, please initialize the parameters.

AL.102.Alarm_reason: At least 2 input ports have the same choice of functions.
AL.102.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check port input function selection parameters
AL.102.Disposal_measures:
Set parameters correctly
Drive to power again

AL.103.Alarm_reason: At least 2 output ports have the same choice of functions.
AL.103.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check port output function selection parameters
AL.103.Disposal_measures:
Set parameters correctly
Drive to power again

AL.105.Alarm_reason: Electronic gear ratio setting error or biaxial sysnchronization output pulse set too small.
AL.105.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check the electronic gear ratio setting parameters. P03-10, P03-11, or check the number of feedback loops of the rotating motor inbiaxial sysnchronization: P03-52 must be greater than 128.
AL.105.Disposal_measures: Set the electronic gear ratio correctly or correctly set the number of feedback pulses in the rotation of the biaxial sysnchronization motor.

AL.106.Alarm_reason: The frequency pulse output parameter setting is out of range.
AL.106.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check the frequency pulse output setting parameters. P03-22，P03-23，P03-25
AL.106.Disposal_measures:
Set the frequency pulse output parameters correctly.
Incremental encoder P03-22 < P03-23
Bus encoder P03-25<65535
Drive to power again

AL.110.Alarm_Content_: Need to power-on again after the parameter setting
AL.110.Alarm_reason: After the servo parameters are set, it is necessary to power up again.

AL.120.Alarm_reason:
Servo ON instruction performs auxiliary functions.
R, S, T voltage port is not powered.
AL.120.Disposal_measures:
Check the wiring
Make the drive repower

AL.400.Alarm_reason: Three phase power supply lacking phase of the driver's R, S and T
AL.400.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check the power cable connected to the drive.
AL.400.Disposal_measures: Reconnect the power cord according to the wiring mode of the instruction manual.

AL.401.Alarm_reason: The main circuit input voltage is lower than the rated voltage or no input voltage.
AL.401.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check whether the main circuit input R, S, T wiring is correct, and the volt of voltage value
AL.401.Disposal_measures: Ensure proper wiring, use proper voltage source or series voltage stabilizer.

AL.402.Alarm_reason:
1. The main circuit input voltage is higher than the rated voltage value.
2, drive hardware fault
3. No regeneration resistor or the use the wrong regeneration resistor
AL.402.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1. Use the voltmeter to test whether the input voltage of the main circuit is correct.
2, when the input voltage is correct, it still has overvoltage alarm.
3. Confirm that P00-30 is set to 0 or 1.
AL.402.Disposal_measures:
1. Use the correct voltage source or series voltage stabilizer.
2, please send it back to the dealer or the original factory.
3. Correct setting and external regeneration resistance.

AL.410.Alarm_reason:
1. When the motor starts, the machine is stuck.
2,There is problem with drive hardware
AL.410.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1, Check whether the mechanical connection is stuck.
2, Confirm that the normal part of the machine is still on the alert.
AL.410.Disposal_measures:
1, Adjust the mechanical structure.
2, Please send it back to the dealer or the original factory.

AL.412.Alarm_reason:
1. Continuous use when it exceeds the driver's rated load 2. Improper setting of control system parameters.
3, motor wiring error
AL.412.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1, can be monitored through the monitoring mode d13.oL..
2.1, whether the mechanical system is installed.
2.2. The acceleration setting constant is too fast.
2.3. Is the gain class parameter set correctly?
3. Check the wiring of U, V and W.
AL.412.Disposal_measures:
1, Change the motor or reduce the load.
2.1. Adjust the gain of control loop.
2.2, The setting time of acceleration and deceleration slows down.
3.Wiring correctly

AL.420.Alarm_reason:
1, the input speed command is too high.
2. Incorrect setting of over speed parameters.
AL.420.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1, use signal detector to check whether the input signal is normal.
2. Check whether the setting of P04-05(overspeed alarm value) is reasonable .
AL.420.Disposal_measures:
1, adjust the frequency of input signal.
2. Set P04-05 correctly (overspeed alarm value).

AL.421.Alarm_reason:
1, motor power line U, V, W wiring error.
2, the motor parameters are not set correctly.
AL.421.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1. Check wiring.
2, check the P00-05; and whether the encoder parameters are set correctly.

AL.430.Alarm_reason:
1. Wrong selection of regenerative resistor or no external regeneration resistor.
2, parameter setting error.
AL.430.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1. Check the connection status of regenerative resistor.
2, please confirm P00-30, P00-31, P00-32 parameter settings.
AL.430.Disposal_measures:
1, if the connection is normal, please send the driver back to the factory.
2. Set parameter values correctly.

AL.431.Alarm_reason: Regenerative resistor selection error or no external regeneration resistor.
AL.431.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check the connection status of regenerative resistors and the resistance of regenerative resistors and whether the power is suitable.

AL.432.Alarm_Content_: Regeneration of Short circuit Open circuit
AL.432.Alarm_reason:
1. Regeneration short circuit
2, regeneration open circuit
AL.432.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1, check whether there is a short circuit on the B1/B3 port.
2, please confirm P00-30, P00-31, P00-32 parameter settings.
AL.432.Disposal_measures:
1. If there is no short circuit in B1/B3, but it still be in alarm. Please send the driver back to the factory.
2. Set parameter values correctly.

AL.440.Alarm_reason: The internal temperature of the actuator is higher than 95 C.
AL.440.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check whether the heat dissipation condition of the driver is good.
AL.440.Disposal_measures: Improve the heat dissipation condition of the driver. If the alarm occurs again, please send the driver back to the original plant.

AL.501.Alarm_reason:
1. position deviation is too large, setting parameter is too small.
2. Gain is set too small.
3. The internal torque limit is set too small.
4, external load is too large.
AL.501.Fault_alarm_checking_:
1, confirm the setting of P03-15 (location deviation too large) parameter setting.
2. Confirm whether the gain parameter is reasonable.
3. Confirm the internal torque limiting amplitude.
4. Check external loads.
AL.501.Disposal_measures:
1, increase the setting value of P03-15 (excessive location deviation).
2, adjust the gain parameters correctly.
3. Re adjust the internal torque limit correctly.
4, reduce load or replace high-power motor.

AL.502.Alarm_Content_: The error of Full closed loop encoder position and Motor position is too large

AL.505.Alarm_Content_: Input pulse of pulse command is abnormal
AL.505.Alarm_reason: The pulse command frequency is higher than the rated input frequency.
AL.505.Fault_alarm_checking_: Using pulse frequency meter to check whether the input frequency is higher than the rated input frequency.
AL.505.Disposal_measures: Set the input pulse frequency correctly.

AL.510.Alarm_Content_: 龙门同动偏差过大 Inertia identification failure fault

AL.551.Alarm_reason: Time of running back to origin is overtime
AL.551.Fault_alarm_checking_: Confirm whether the parameter P03-68 (the longest time limit of search origin) is reasonable

AL.600.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check whether encoder power +5V and GND are reversed.

AL.610.Alarm_Content_: Incremental encoder gets out of line
AL.610.Alarm_reason: Abnormal signalHallU, HallV, HallW of incremental encoder

AL.621.Alarm_Content_: Read and write motor encoder EEPROM parameter abnormal

AL.622.Alarm_Content_: motor encoder EEPROM data parity error

AL.640.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check encoder wiring Confirm the correct connection of the encoder shields.
AL.640.Disposal_measures: Speed down If the connection is normal, please send the drive back to the factory.

AL.642.Alarm_Content_: Bus type encoder Battery low voltage alarm
AL.642.Alarm_reason: When the bus encoder is set to multi cycle absolute value, the external battery voltage is low.
AL.642.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check the external battery voltage of the encoder, confirm that it is higher than 3.0V.

AL.643.Alarm_Content_: Bus type encoder Battery low voltage fault
AL.643.Alarm_reason: When the bus encoder is set to multi cycle absolute value, the external battery voltage is low.
AL.643.Fault_alarm_checking_: Check the external battery voltage of the encoder, confirm that it is higher than 3.1V.

AL.645.Alarm_reason: The number of revolving circles of bus encoder is out of range.
AL.645.Fault_alarm_checking_: Whether the P00-09 setting is 1, and can not single direction.
AL.645.Disposal_measures: Clearing multiple loop values with instruction AF_En1

AL.647.Alarm_reason: The deviation of the installation position of the split encoder is too large.

AL.901.Alarm_Content_: When servo ON, Position deviation is too large

AL.925.Alarm_Content_: External regeneration bleeder resistor is too small

AL.941.Alarm_Content_: Need to power-on again after Parameters changing

AL.943.Alarm_reason:
Serial communication interference
Serial port baud rate set too high
AL.943.Fault_alarm_checking_:
Check the wiring
Check the baud rate parameter P00-21 of serial port communication
AL.943.Disposal_measures: Adding filter on wire Reduce the baud rate of serial communication
